{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Sales Manager",
  "description": "Salpha Energy is a renewable energy company determined to provide affordable solar solutions for everyone. We are addressing the huge market need for energy by enabling people harness the infinite source of light that freely accessible to everyone.

Innovations in renewable technology afford us the opportunity to place power back in the hands of people, through innovative and quality conscious products that are built to last for outdoor campaing, entrepreneurial activities, rural settlements or disaster relief.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Sales Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	We are seeking a commercially astute, execution-strong Senior Sales Manager to work alongside the National Sales Manager, anchoring field sales execution, Go-To-Market architecture, and commercial analytics.
	This role is central to driving performance across our sales networks including dealership, MFIs, direct sales teams, and strategic partnerships.
	You will be blending strategy, operational leadership, analytical capability and behavioral insight to fuel Salpha&rsquo;s growth.
	The ideal candidate will be experienced in multi-channel sales management, adept at leveraging technology and data-driven insights for decision-making and skilled in leading diverse teams across multiple locations.


Key Responsibilities
Sales Strategy &amp; Go To Market Execution:


	Co-develop and implement the company-wide Go-To-Market (GTM) strategy across all channels ensuring alignment with corporate objectives.
	Drive territory mapping, outlet rollouts, and market activation playbooks
	Lead pilot tests for pricing, bundling, and promotion strategies across new products
	Work with the NSM to ensure consistent achievement of monthly, quarterly, and annual sales quotas across all regions and Channels.


Field Sales Leadership &amp; Accountability:


	Supervise regional sales teams and outlet managers to meet monthly targets
	Establish field performance systems (daily check-ins, agent logs, inventory audits)
	Ensure last-mile availability, stock hygiene, and return/warranty loop closure
	Implement standardized processes, performance tracking systems, and reporting frameworks.


Data Analytics &amp; Market Intelligence:


	Track sales KPIs, inventory flows, MFI repayments, and conversion rates
	Commission and interpret market intelligence reports (pricing trends, competitor benchmarks, behavioral insights, sales analytics, forecasting, and reporting), providing actionable insights to management.
	Lead A/B testing and translate findings into GTM adjustments


Team Development &amp; Culture Building:


	Train, coach, and performance-manage field teams to strengthen sales capabilities.
	Champion a &ldquo;data-informed field discipline&rdquo; culture.
	Foster a culture of accountability, innovation, and customer-centricity within the sales team.
	Work with the HR department in recruitment and onboarding of sales staff to ensure they have the product knowledge and sales skills required for success.


Technology &amp; Process Optimization:


	Leverage sales analytics tools, sales dashboards, and digital platforms to enhance sales visibility and decision-making.
	Monitor key metrics and identify areas for process improvement.
	Recommend and implement technology-driven solutions to improve customer engagement and sales efficiency.


Stakeholder Management &amp; Partnerships:


	Maintain strong relationships with dealers, MFIs, distributors, and institutional partners to ensure sustainable growth.
	Work closely with the marketing communication team to design campaigns that align with sales objectives.
	Engage with internal stakeholders (finance, logistics, Engineering and production and customer service) to ensure smooth execution of sales strategies.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field (MBA is a plus)
	8&ndash;12 years in B2C/B2B2C sales leadership roles
	Certifications in Sales Management, Data Analytics, or GTM Strategy are advantageous
	Proven GTM execution experience in FMCG, solar, telecoms, fintech, or field-heavy start-ups
	Demonstrated success scaling field teams in multiple geographies


Skills:


	Strong understanding of route-to-market (RTM) strategies and sales channel optimization
	Proficiency in sales analytics, CRM systems, Google Sheets, or BI dashboards
	Strong leadership presence, coaching orientation, and excellent communication skills.
	High adaptability in a fast-paced, target-driven environment.
	Excellent Relationship and stakeholder management skills.
	Ability to connect day-to-day sales activities with the company&#39;s overarching financial and strategic goals.
	Ability to travel across field locations.


Behavioural:


	Excellent team player and people management skills.
	High integrity with strong adherence to processes and standards.
	A strong sense of personal ownership for the team&#39;s performance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;salpha@salphaenergy.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

        Salpha Energy is a renewable energy company determined to provide affordable solar solutions for everyone. We are addressing the huge market need for energy by enabling people harness the infinite source of light that freely accessible to everyone.

Innovations in renewable technology afford us the opportunity to place power back in the hands of people, through innovative and quality conscious products that are built to last for outdoor campaing, entrepreneurial activities, rural settlements or disaster relief.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Sales Manager
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a commercially astute, execution-strong Senior Sales Manager to work alongside the National Sales Manager, anchoring field sales execution, Go-To-Market architecture, and commercial analytics.
	This role is central to driving performance across our sales networks including dealership, MFIs, direct sales teams, and strategic partnerships.
	You will be blending strategy, operational leadership, analytical capability and behavioral insight to fuel Salpha’s growth.
	The ideal candidate will be experienced in multi-channel sales management, adept at leveraging technology and data-driven insights for decision-making and skilled in leading diverse teams across multiple locations.

Sales Strategy & Go To Market Execution:


	Co-develop and implement the company-wide Go-To-Market (GTM) strategy across all channels ensuring alignment with corporate objectives.
	Drive territory mapping, outlet rollouts, and market activation playbooks
	Lead pilot tests for pricing, bundling, and promotion strategies across new products
	Work with the NSM to ensure consistent achievement of monthly, quarterly, and annual sales quotas across all regions and Channels.


Field Sales Leadership & Accountability:


	Supervise regional sales teams and outlet managers to meet monthly targets
	Establish field performance systems (daily check-ins, agent logs, inventory audits)
	Ensure last-mile availability, stock hygiene, and return/warranty loop closure
	Implement standardized processes, performance tracking systems, and reporting frameworks.


Data Analytics & Market Intelligence:


	Track sales KPIs, inventory flows, MFI repayments, and conversion rates
	Commission and interpret market intelligence reports (pricing trends, competitor benchmarks, behavioral insights, sales analytics, forecasting, and reporting), providing actionable insights to management.
	Lead A/B testing and translate findings into GTM adjustments


Team Development & Culture Building:


	Train, coach, and performance-manage field teams to strengthen sales capabilities.
	Champion a “data-informed field discipline” culture.
	Foster a culture of accountability, innovation, and customer-centricity within the sales team.
	Work with the HR department in recruitment and onboarding of sales staff to ensure they have the product knowledge and sales skills required for success.


Technology & Process Optimization:


	Leverage sales analytics tools, sales dashboards, and digital platforms to enhance sales visibility and decision-making.
	Monitor key metrics and identify areas for process improvement.
	Recommend and implement technology-driven solutions to improve customer engagement and sales efficiency.


Stakeholder Management & Partnerships:


	Maintain strong relationships with dealers, MFIs, distributors, and institutional partners to ensure sustainable growth.
	Work closely with the marketing communication team to design campaigns that align with sales objectives.
	Engage with internal stakeholders (finance, logistics, Engineering and production and customer service) to ensure smooth execution of sales strategies.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field (MBA is a plus)
	8–12 years in B2C/B2B2C sales leadership roles
	Certifications in Sales Management, Data Analytics, or GTM Strategy are advantageous
	Proven GTM execution experience in FMCG, solar, telecoms, fintech, or field-heavy start-ups
	Demonstrated success scaling field teams in multiple geographies


Skills:


	Strong understanding of route-to-market (RTM) strategies and sales channel optimization
	Proficiency in sales analytics, CRM systems, Google Sheets, or BI dashboards
	Strong leadership presence, coaching orientation, and excellent communication skills.
	High adaptability in a fast-paced, target-driven environment.
	Excellent Relationship and stakeholder management skills.
	Ability to connect day-to-day sales activities with the company's overarching financial and strategic goals.
	Ability to travel across field locations.


Behavioural:


	Excellent team player and people management skills.
	High integrity with strong adherence to processes and standards.
	A strong sense of personal ownership for the team's performance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: salpha@salphaenergy.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Human Resource Officer Job at FoodOnline Limited




        
    

        
        FoodOnline Limited - In a fast-paced world with cutting-edge technology and timelines, Food online is a people-centric online food delivery startup committed to satisfying your cravings and stomach demands within the shortest time. We connect you to your favorite Local restaurants, Craving spots and chefs delivering directly to doorsteps.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

            
    




	FoodOnline is expanding, and we are looking for dynamic HR personnel to join our team. As we grow our operations, the HR function will play a critical role in building strong teams, driving culture, and ensuring seamless people management across the organization.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead recruitment, onboarding, and employee development.
	Implement HR policies, procedures, and compliance frameworks.
	Manage payroll, employee relations, and performance reviews.
	Support management with workforce planning and strategy.
	Drive a positive workplace culture that fosters growth and accountability.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a B.Sc Degree with a minimum of 1 year of experience.


What We Offer


	Opportunity to shape the HR framework of a growing online food delivery company.
	Dynamic and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: foodonlinehr@gmail.com using "HR Manager Application" as the subject of the email

Business Development Officer Job at Olman Business Solution




        
    

        
        Olman Business Solution - Our client is a leading indigenous oil & gas service company, known for its strong technical capabilities, operational reliability and commitment to local content development.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Officer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	Are you passionate about driving growth, building relationships, and creating business opportunities? We are seeking a results-driven Business Development Officer to join our dynamic team.
	In this role, you will play a key part in expanding our client base, developing new markets, and contributing to the company’s long-term growth strategy.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities through market research, networking, and lead generation.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients and partners.
	Develop proposals, presentations, and business pitches to prospective clients.
	Negotiate contracts and close deals that align with company objectives.
	Monitor industry trends, competitor activities, and market dynamics to inform strategy.
	Collaborate with internal teams to deliver tailored solutions that meet client needs.
	Prepare business reports, forecasts, and performance updates.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business administration, Marketing, Economics, or a related field.
	2–5 years of proven experience in business development, sales, or client relationship management.
	Strong track record of achieving sales targets and driving business growth.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite and CRM tools.
	Self-motivated, results-oriented, and able to work independently or in a team.


What We Offer


	Salary: N200,000 per month.
	Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
	Opportunities for career growth and professional development.
	A dynamic and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cover Letter and Resume explaining their interest and suitability for the role to: careers@olmanbsl.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	Olman Business Solutions is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion.
	We encourage qualified individuals from all backgrounds to apply.

Key Responsibilities


	Develop, implement, and manage engaging social media strategies across multiple platforms.
	Create, edit, and publish compelling multimedia content (short videos, reels, graphics, and motion graphics) optimized for each platform.
	Leverage AI tools (such as ChatGPT, Canva AI, etc.) for content ideation, copywriting, trend analysis, and creative asset generation.
	Monitor, analyze, and report on social media performance using analytics tools, providing actionable insights.
	Stay up to date with social media trends, platform updates, AI advancements, and best practices in digital marketing.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure consistent branding and messaging.
	Manage community interactions by responding to comments, messages, and inquiries promptly


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Social Media Specialist, Digital Marketer, or similar role.
	Strong proficiency in video editing software (Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, CapCut, or similar).
	Working knowledge of AI-powered tools for content creation, editing, analytics, or automation.
	Familiarity with graphic design tools (Canva, Photoshop, Illustrator) is an added advantage.
	Deep understanding of social media platforms (Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, X/Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, etc.) and their algorithms.
	Creative mindset with strong storytelling skills.
	Ability to manage multiple projects, meet deadlines, and work independently or collaboratively.
	Excellent communication and organizational skills.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits.
	A dynamic and innovative work environment.
	Professional growth and exposure to advanced AI and digital marketing tools.
	Exciting projects and the opportunity to shape the company’s digital voice.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, portfolio (including video samples, and projects): submitcv.rcsn@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
